pageContext.description:
'Barbara, Duchess of Saxony (1478-1534) was the daughter of Casimir IV, King of Poland and Elisabeth of Austria. In 1496 she married George, Duke of Saxony (1471-1539), whose portrait was also painted by Cranach. Both appear as donors on two panels from an altarpiece in the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection (see FR 1978, no. 28, p. 74), probably dating from around 1508-10. The portrait of the Duchess in this work formed the basis of later depictions including the present work, which was executed by the workshop most probably after her death.'
[Christie's Online database; https://www.christies.com/lotfinder/paintings/studio-of-lucas-cranach-i-portrait-of-4942828-details.aspx; accessed 29 Nov 2017]
[Friedländer, Rosenberg 1979, 154, No. 414]

pageContext.provenance:
- Professor Dr. Freiherr Friedrich Wilhelm von Bissing (1873-1956), Munich, circa 1910
- Daniel George van Beuningen (1877-1955), Vierhouten, Rotterdam
- with Jacques Goudstikker, Amsterdam
- looted by the Nazi authorities, July 1940
- recovered by the Allies, 1945
- in the custody of the Dutch Government
- restituted in February 2006 to the heir of Jacques Goudstikker 
- 5-6 July 2007 auctioned at Christie's London, lot 5
[Christie's Online database; https://www.christies.com/lotfinder/paintings/studio-of-lucas-cranach-i-portrait-of-4942828-details.aspx; accessed 29 Nov 2017]

See also the entry in the DHM-database: Datenblatt RMG00467; https://www.dhm.de/datenbank/goering/dhm_goering.php?seite=5&fld_0=RMG00467 (accessed 17 Dec. 2019).
pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia at the right edge: serpent (with dropped wings)
